meanings.definition: Not leading to a firm conclusion or result.
meanings.sent1: The experiment's results were inconclusive, so we couldn't be sure of the answer.
meanings.sent2: The inconclusive evidence left the detectives puzzled about the crime.
meanings.sent3: The inconclusive test results made everyone scratch their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her feelings towards him were as inconclusive as a riddle without an answer.
meanings.sent5: The inconclusive nature of the situation made it hard to make a decision.

meanings.definition: Failing to resolve a question or uncertainty.
meanings.sent1: The inconclusive meeting left us with more questions than answers.
meanings.sent2: The inconclusive discussion only added to the confusion in the group.
meanings.sent3: His inconclusive explanation of the situation made us all chuckle at his confusion.
meanings.sent4: The inconclusive debate was like a never-ending loop of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The inconclusive nature of the puzzle kept us guessing for hours.
